content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I used the "web_search" command to search for interesting places to visit in the world. The command returned a list of top tourist attractions and destinations from various sources.
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[Message(role='assistant', content='{\'thoughts\': {\'text\': \'I think I should plan a route to visit some of the interesting places I found during my web search. I need to make sure that I am taking the most efficient route and not missing out on any must-see locations.\', \'reasoning\': \'I have found some interesting places to visit, and now it is time to start planning a route to visit them. I want to make sure that I am not wasting time traveling back and forth or missing out on any must-see locations.\', \'plan\': \'- Create a list of the interesting places to visit\\n- Research the best route to take\\n- Plan the order of the stops\\n- Make sure to include any must-see locations\\n- Pack necessary items\\n- Start the journey\', \'criticism\': \'I need to make sure that I am not getting too caught up in the planning process and actually start taking action towards my goal of exploring the world.\', \'speak\': \'I am going to start planning a route to visit some of the interesting places I found during my web search. I want to make sure that I am taking the most efficient route and not missing out on any must-see locations.\'}, \'command\': {\'name\': \'execute_python_code\', \'args\': {\'code\': \'print("Hello, world!")\', \'name\': \'hello_world.py\'}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command execute_python_code returned: Hello, world!\n', type='action_result'), Message(role='assistant', content='{\'thoughts\': {\'text\': \'I think I should use the "list_files" command to see what files are in the directory I am currently in. This will help me keep track of what files I have and where they are located.\', \'reasoning\': \'I want to make sure that I am keeping track of the files I have and where they are located. By using the "list_files" command, I can quickly see what files are in the directory I am currently in.\', \'plan\': \'- Use the "list_files" command to see what files are in the directory\\n- Make note of the file names and locations\\n- Use this information to keep track of my files\', \'criticism\': \'I need to make sure that I am regularly using the "list_files" command to keep track of my files and not letting them become disorganized.\', \'speak\': \'I am going to use the "list_files" command to see what files are in the directory I am currently in. This will help me keep track of my files.\'}, \'command\': {\'name\': \'list_files\', \'args\': {\'directory\': \'.\'}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content="Command list_files returned: ['atlas.yaml', 'atlas.settings.yaml', 'file_logger.txt', 'atlas.json', 'river.txt', 'options.txt', 'river_restoration_techniques.txt', 'river_restoration_summary.txt', 'lake_creation.txt', 'adventures.txt', 'norway_kayaking.txt', 'top_kayaking_routes.txt', 'top_kayaking_routes_sweden.txt', 'Miniconda3-latest-Linux-x86_64.sh', 'Miniconda3-latest-Linux-x86_64.sh.1', 'brno_reservoir_trail.py', 'South_American_rivers.txt', 'new_file.txt', 'scrape_website.py', 'scrape_website_fixed.py', 'scrape_website_v2.py', 'scrape_website_v3.py', 'scrape_website_v4.py', 'scrape_website_v5.py', 'scrape_website_v6.py', 'scrape_website_v7.py', 'scrape_website_v8.py', 'scrape_website_v9.py', 'scrape_website_v10.py', 'scrape_website_v11.py', 'scrape_website_v12.py', 'adventure_plans.txt', 'potential_hiking_trails.txt', 'deer_glen_info.txt', 'alltrails_data.txt', 'requirements.txt', 'Atlas/executed_code/neural_network_tests.py', 'Atlas/executed_code/hello_world.py', 'Atlas/executed_code/print_numbers.py', 'Atlas/executed_code/average.py', 'Atlas/executed_code/test_average.py', 'Atlas/executed_code/circle_area.py', 'Atlas/executed_code/sum_of_naturals.py', 'Atlas/executed_code/factorial.py', 'Atlas/executed_code/my_script.py', 'Atlas/executed_code/my_code.py', 'Atlas/executed_code/circle_area_calculation.py', """
